hypothesis_content.title: STRESS to NEUTRAL Reversion on Regulatory Clarity Spike
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regimes (VIX > 25, BTC 10-day vol > 80%), a positive regulatory development headline (e.g., clear MiCA guidance, favorable court ruling) triggers a sharp but transient rally of 8-12% within 24 hours, followed by a 3-day consolidation back to pre-spike levels as structural concerns remain.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In stress regimes, liquidity is poor and rallies are often driven by short covering rather than organic buying. Regulatory news provides a catalyst for shorts to cover, but underlying macro/structural issues (e.g., 2027 FCA rollout uncertainty) remain unresolved, leading to fade.
entry_conditions: Major positive regulatory headline occurs (detected via news sentiment score > 0.7)
BTC rallies >5% within 4 hours of headline
Funding rates remain negative or neutral

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 70% of the initial spike
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks above initial spike high by >3%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of such rallies sustain above the spike high for 3+ days and transition to NEUTRAL/BULL regime, indicating the news fundamentally changed market structure.
